modules.comments:
The main module of the `marionette` runtime. You need a `Controller` and a
`Renderer` in addition to the types and functions that are defined in here to
run a state machine program.

declarations.comments:
Type variables:
- `msg` the message type of your program
- `sta` the state type of your program

Record fields:
- `exitIf` provides an exit condition to leave the running state machine
  based on the current message/state combination.
- `initialMsg` useful if the first message event is not triggered by user input.
- `onEvent` lets you observe events that occur inside the `marionette`
  runtime. This is useful for either debugging or other kind of state
  machine flow analysis.
- `stateHandler` The state implementation that is used by the runtime.
declarations.title: Config

children.comments: new thread is triggered by a message event
children.title: NewMsg

children.comments: specific thread triggered by a message event has finished running
children.title: EndMsg

children.comments: new state update has been performed and a re-rendering was triggered
children.title: NewState

declarations.comments: Possible observable events that may occur inside the `marionette` runtime.
declarations.title: EventType

declarations.comments:
Type variables:
- `msg` message type of your program
- `sta` state type of your program

Record fields:
- `initialState` value of the initial state
- `renderer` specifies how state is rendered
- `controller` specifies the how the control flow is handled
declarations.title: Program

declarations.comments:
General program event type that contains a timestamp and a more specific
event type.
declarations.title: ProgramEvent

declarations.comments:
Every time a message is raised a new thread with an unique `ThreadId` is created that has read and
write access to the program's state.
declarations.title: ThreadId

declarations.comments: Some defaults for the [Config](#t:Config) type
declarations.title: defaultConfig

declarations.comments: A controller that does nothing. Useful if you just want to render something and the controller is not implemented yet.
declarations.title: noController

declarations.comments: A renderer that does nothing. Useful if like to run a headless state machine.
declarations.title: noRenderer

declarations.comments:
Takes a stateful program specification and some configuration and runs the
program in an `Aff` context.

Once the program has finished the final state is returned and all running
threads are aborted.
declarations.title: runProgram

modules.name: Marionette

modules.comments:
A Control handler that runs in `Aff` and provides a beginner friendly API
to handle state updates with effects.

declarations.comments:
The high level control function. Takes an interface to a control API
and a `msg` and returns an effectful computation inside `Aff`.
declarations.title: Control

declarations.comments:
Provides read/write access to the current state and a way to raise new
messages at any time in the control handler

- `sendMsg` Raise a new message.
- `getState` Set the current state.
- `putState` Set the state.
- `modifyState` Modify the state by applying a function to the current state. The returned value is the new state value.
- `modifyState_` Modify the state by applying a function to the current state.
declarations.title: ControlAPI

declarations.comments: Creates a low level controller when given a high level control function
declarations.title: mkController

modules.name: Marionette.Controllers.ControlAPI

modules.comments:
This module provides the most flexible way to handle state control via a
`MarionetteT` monad transformer.

declarations.comments:
The high level control function. Takes a `msg` and returns a computation
inside the `MarionetteT` monad transformer.
declarations.title: Control

declarations.comments:
A monad transformer that adds the following features to the base monad `m`

- read/write access to the program's state (`sta`) via a StateMonad instance
- the ability to use `sendMsg` to raise messages (values of type `msg`)
  from within a control handler
declarations.title: MarionetteT

declarations.comments: Creates a low level controller when given a high level control function
declarations.title: mkController

declarations.comments: Triggers a new message from within a control handler
declarations.title: sendMsg

modules.name: Marionette.Controllers.Monadic

modules.comments: A simplistic controller that is completely pure and does not perform any side effects.

declarations.comments: Pure update Function
declarations.title: UpdateFn

declarations.comments: Creates a low level controller when given a pure update function
declarations.title: mkController

modules.name: Marionette.Controllers.Pure

modules.comments:
This module contains types that are only needed for low level
Renderer/Controller implementations.

declarations.comments:
A controller is defined as a computation that runs in `Aff` when given 
an implementation to send messages, a low level `State` implementation
along with the current a messsage that has been triggered.
declarations.title: Controller

declarations.comments:
Type variables:
- `msg` message type of your program
- `sta` state type of your program

Record fields:
- `onInit` runs before the state machine starts
- `onState` runs on every state update
- `onFinish` runs before the state machine exits
declarations.title: Renderer

declarations.comments: Defines how messages can be triggered by the runtime
declarations.title: SendMsg

declarations.comments:
Low level state implementation that allows to derive reading and updating
state functions
declarations.title: State

modules.name: Marionette.Types
